pageContext.claim: “The driving factor in the surge of illegal families and minors is the belief that there will be no consequence for illegal entry, and no likelihood of removal or reprisal.”
pageContext.analysis: The Congressional Research Service said in a 2014 report that "high violent crime rates, poor economic conditions fueled by relatively low economic growth rates, high rates of poverty, and the presence of transnational gangs" were some of the motivating factors for the waves of immigrants seeking entry into the United States in recent years.
